borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="">The proposed development by reason of its position, width, scale, and&nbsp;design (particularly that of a roof) would&nbsp;introduce a discordant feature that&nbsp;fails to make a positive contribution to the&nbsp;character and appearance of the <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="dwellinghouse" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lr6hn907evvl4olzi" style="">dwellinghouse</span>, the terrace, and wider <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="Becontree" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lr6hn906gbluj1pvk" style="">Becontree</span> Estate which is a non-designated heritage asset know for its homogeneous&nbsp;appearance and layout.&nbsp;As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</p><ul><li>Paragraphs 131, 135, 139, and 209&nbsp;of the National Planning Policy Framework (December&nbsp;2023)</li><li>Policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021)</li><li>Policies CP2 and CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</li><li>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</li><li>Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenhamâ€™s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li><li>Paragraphs 5.1.1, 5.1.3, 5.4.1, 5.4.2&nbsp;of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</li></ul>
description:
Construction of a two storey side extension and single
storey front extension
